message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.LO, cs.CG 

Reasoning: The paper deals with subshifts and tilings, which are topics in discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science. Specifically, it discusses the simulation of 1D effectively closed subshifts using 2D tilings, which involves concepts from dynamical systems, information theory, computational complexity, logic, and computational geometry. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Discrete Mathematics), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), and cs.CG (Computational Geometry).
